newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Agip SpA makes new oil discovery in Tunisia.
newsitem.headline: Agip SpA makes new oil discovery in Tunisia.

text.p: Agip Tunisia, a subsidiary of Italian group Agip SpA, has made a new oil discovery in the Oued Zar production field in southern Tunisia, energy officials said on Tuesday.
The Oued Zar-I well has tested up to 2500 bpd, Agip's engeneer Jamel Ben Yacoub told an oil conference.

The Tunisian state-run oil company ETAP, which owns half of the permit, confirmed the discovery at the opening session of the four-day fifth Tunisian Petroleum Exploration Conference in Tunis, attended by more than 200 oil experts.

ETAP added that a long-term test started in August 1996 for a period of 60 days in order to observe the performance of the two oil bearing levels A1 and A3. It said that the current production rate from the A3 reservoir is 850 bpd.

Ben Yacoub told the conference that the discovery in the Upper Silurian Acacus sandstones upgrades the area as a new promising play. The recent regional geological assessment, together with the Oued Zar discovery, showed that the Acacus sandstones have "fair to good reservoir quality," he added.
